text: Timika is a chartered city (kota), and the capital of Mimika Regency on the southern coast of Papua, Indonesia. In 2014, the city had a population of around 130,000. ==Air transport== In August 2012, the Indonesian government announced plans to develop a new commercial airport in Timika. The Mozes Kilangin International Airport will feature a new apron and taxiway created on an 800x300m plot of land adjacent to the existing airport. Beginning from August 15, 2014, the airline Garuda Indonesia has been serving the Timika- Sorong-Manado route for 3 times a week with a Bombardier CRJ-1000 plane that has 84 economy class seats and 12 business class seats. ==Climate== Timika has a tropical rainforest climate (Af) with heavy to very heavy rainfall year- round. ==References== Category:Populated places in Papua (province) Category:Districts of Papua (province) Category:Regency seats of Papua (province)
title: Timika
